params.note: Data collected from 806,646 cells across 218 samples from 54 publications using scRNA-seq methods including 10x Genomics (3',v.3; 3',v.2; 5',v.1; 5',v.2), CEL-seq, CEL-seq2, Smart-seq, and Sort-seq. Source materials: PSCs (embryonic and induced), FSCs, ASCs. Tissues: intestine, lung, liver, biliary system, pancreas, stomach, salivary gland, prostate, thyroid. Organoid models: PSC-, FSC-, and ASC-derived.

Cell clustering and annotation performed at high resolution using marker gene expression and differential expression analysis. Hierarchical annotation system: level 1 (class), level 2 (type), level 3 (subtype).
12 data-integration methods benchmarked; scPoli selected for integration of organoid single-cell datasets. Integrated embedding generated for cohesive representation.

Integrated atlas reannotated based on most frequent cell type per cluster: 5 classes, 48 types, 51 subtypes. High consistency with original manuscript annotations, except for continuous differentiation states and nomenclature granularity.

Pseudo-bulk analysis on raw and scPoli embeddings revealed stem cell source and tissue type as primary drivers of variance. Integration performance unaffected by stem cell source, scRNA-seq method, or tissue type, but influenced by dataset origin.

Intestinal organoid atlas (HIOCA) constructed from 98 samples (353,140 cells) across 23 publications. Integrated to define 5 level-1, 26 level-2, and 32 level-3 cell types. Includes epithelial, mesenchymal, neural, endothelial, and immune cell populations.
On-target percentages: FSC-derived organoids 91.12%, ASC-derived 98.14%, PSC-derived 23.28â€“83.63% (likely underestimated due to early time points).

Similarity to reference atlases: ASC-derived organoids most similar to adult tissues; PSC-derived most similar to fetal tissues; FSC-derived intermediate. Similarity influenced by publication and stem cell source, not scRNA-seq method, sample count, or gene count.

Marker gene expression heatmap generated for level-2 cell types (e.g., EPCAM, OLFM4, CDX2, TFF3, MUC5AC, KRT7, DLK1, PROX1, HAND1, DCN, TCF21, LUM, POSTN, CHGA, TOP2A, PDGFRA, CA7, SPIB, SFTPB, NKX2-1, HOPX, KRT14, ELAVL3, PAX8, DEFA5, DEFA6, SPINK4, ESAM, CDH5, RBP4, ASGR1, AVIL, PLCG2, PTPRC, CD14).
